ffs guys, these comments are a disgrace to weebdom. In Japan, what the young gyaru-o 'bully' is doing is definitely considered bullying because he's  forcing the nerd to give up his time for the benefit of the other guy in exchange for nothing with the implication that if the nerd said no, he'd pay the price.  For us overseas it doesn't register because Japan is highly collectivist and deeply values stability. Making a scene or being part of a problem is a huge strike against you even if it wasn't your fault so the Japanese often go along to get along, yeah? eh, nevermind. Modern weebs are garbo.

I took away that it started off with the dude forcing the nerd to do his homework for him, but when he saw how proud his mom was he started to put in a more concerted effort which led to him actually trying and ultimately deciding to better his future.

The bullying isn't shown very well here, but it is implied. The payoff is hampered by the fact that there's no real actual messed up stuff the Gyaru-oh does outside of forcing dude to do his homework, and he actually grows as a responsible person by the end of the dj.

If this was a manga I could see the bully being the main character trying to be better and his classmate that's banging his mom would be the antagonist for a lack of better words. The bully would come to thank the classmate and see him as a friend if not someone he respects for helping him further his education and they end up going to the same university. Later his mom gets pregnant and is ashamed to tell him the truth so she moves or refuses to see him, leaving him staying at his dad's place (now divorced) and this devastating event leads him to rely even more on his classmate for emotional support. Not knowing anything yet he continues his studies and finds love, just when it seems he is getting the reigns of his life back his classmate is showing signs of depression, anxiety and even suicidal indicators as he withdraws from society. The bully wants to repay him in his time of need so he tries to help only to begin a daunting series of discoveries. Shitty plot I know but I would rea
